A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Ok\, let's cut the sh**.  The  93% hast to be\, it HAS to be\, from people paid by Disney.  There is no other explanation for correlating what I just watched with that rating. 
"It was right up there with Empire Strikes Back!"
Shut up. No it wasn't. You have no idea what you are talking about.  ESB did not have a subplot taking up a significant part of the timeframe that had  *literally* no pay off. Casino planet to get this codebreaker to sabotage the tracker to...suspension of disbelief is officially gone. Nevermind that it lead to nothing- it made no sense.
Empire Strikes Back also had no obvious axe to grind. Minority quota for the good guys but not bad guys? Check.  Animal acitivism subplot? Check. Anti-capitalism soapbox? Check. Beyond being preachy\, it dates the film\, considerably.
Then we have another pink elephant in the room- Snoke. They had all of this mystery and build up in the previous film(which\, aside for being an obvious soft reboot\, was decent). Now- no explanation for it. He gets killed off rather nonchalantly.
So we have poorly developed characters\, some being killed off for no reason\, subplots that lead to nowhere\, underlying agendas and a main story without any real thrust.  Then there is the tone- all over the place. Namely humor where it shouldn't have been that sort of kills the tension.
